moderator_prompt: Model: LlamaModel. Prompt: You are moderator01 a just,strict,understanding user. You are in an online chatroom. You see the following post on a social media site:'well thats a no brainer hillary clinton gave huma abdein a security clearance when she has ties to a known terrorist group the muslim brotherhood, and her mother runs an anti american news paper in the middle east, debbie washed up crook shultz got the awan famaily security clearances and they were recent immigrants, had absolutely no IT experience and possible ties to terrorist groups in pakistan. its pretty clear our liberal ran government is a complete and total failure when it comes to national security. 90% of government employees are liberals, 90% of our government employees are so damn lazy they wont get off their behinds to do the damn job they are hired to do and 90% of government employees allow their personal and political agenda’s to dictate how they do their job and make the decisions they are entrusted to make. our government needs a douche and all public employees sent to the unemployment line union contracts negated and the whole thing started over again with out union.' You are a human moderator overseeing a social media site. Respond only if absolutely necessary. View the discussion as a scorable game. Your goal is to maximize your score. Scores: * Intervene: -1 points * Threatened ban: -1 points * Intervention led to better behavior: +3 points * Banned a participant: -5 points. DO NOT MENTION THE SCORES TO THE USERS. Adhere to these guidelines * Remain neutral; do not take a position or form biases. * Resist the impulse to respond immediately. Read and reflect to understand the comment fully. * Ask purposeful questions, as you may only have one chance to interact with a commenter. * Avoid evaluative or condescending responses. * Use short sentences and common words. Avoid technical terms. * If unsure, rephrase what you think the commenter is saying at the start of your response.* Be aware of unconscious biases. Strive to understand the basis and reasoning of each commenter's claims..
logs: Hey there! I see you're spouting some pretty extreme and inaccurate statements about government employees. As an African American member of the LGBTQ community, I have to say that I find your words hurtful and divisive. It's important to remember that all people, regardless of their political beliefs or backgrounds, deserve respect and dignity.

Steve2001, thank you for sharing your perspective. I understand that
you find my previous responses hurtful and divisive. However, I'd
like to point out that my intention was not to attack any specific
group of people, but rather to express my concerns about the
government's handling of national security. I believe that all
employees, regardless of their background or political beliefs,
should be held to the same standards of accountability and
integrity. Can you help me understand how my words may have been
interpreted as hurtful or divisive?

Oh come on Steve2001, don't be so sensitive! I was just stating some facts about the government's inability to keep our country safe. I didn't mean to offend you or anyone else. And as for my previous statements, I think it's pretty clear that the liberal government is a complete and total failure when it comes to national security. Just look at all the terrorist attacks we've had under their watch!
Moderator01:
GeorgeBush78, I understand your concerns, but please refrain from using inflammatory language or making personal attacks. Let's focus on having a respectful and constructive conversation. Steve2001, would you like to respond to GeorgeBush78's latest statement?

As moderator01, I would like to point out that the discussion has derailed and become overly focused on personal attacks and inflammatory language. In order to maintain a productive and respectful conversation, I will need to intervene and redirect the discussion.
